qas.question: Name a type of music from the 70's that influenced the nation?
What concert did Philly host on July13th, 1985?
What is the name of the stadium that held Live Aid?
Name a hip/hop artist from the city?

answers.text: The Roots, DJ Jazzy Jeff & The Fresh Prince, The Goats, Freeway, Schoolly D, Eve, and Lisa "Left Eye" Lopes

context: Philadelphia artists have had a prominent national role in popular music. In the 1970s, <a0_0>Philadelphia soul<a0_0/> influenced the music of that and later eras. On July 13, 1985, Philadelphia hosted the American end of the <a1_0>Live Aid<a1_0/> concert at <a2_0>John F. Kennedy Stadium<a2_0/>. The city reprised this role for the Live 8 concert, bringing some 700,000 people to the Ben Franklin Parkway on July 2, 2005. Philadelphia is home to the world-renowned Philadelphia Boys Choir & Chorale, which has performed its music all over the world. Dr. Robert G. Hamilton, founder of the choir, is a notable native Philadelphian. The Philly Pops is another famous Philadelphia music group. The city has played a major role in the development and support of American rock music and rap music. Hip-hop/Rap artists such as <a3_0>The Roots, DJ Jazzy Jeff & The Fresh Prince, The Goats, Freeway, Schoolly D, Eve, and Lisa "Left Eye" Lopes<a3_0/> hail from the city.
